t: r/amazonprime on Reddit: What even are these brands
Amazon Private Label Brands - Marketplace Pulse
s: March 18, 2019 - According to Marketplace Pulse research, Amazon-owned private label brands are not nearly as successful as many paint them to be. Amazon has been successful in creating generic items at low prices, but only when using the Amazon brand name (i.e., AmazonBasics and Amazon Essentials).

t: Amazon's new shopping feature lets you search for products even if they're not sold on Amazon
s: February 11, 2025 - We’re experimenting with helping customers find products from other brands’ sites when they search in the Amazon Shopping app.

t: What Is Amazon Brand Gating? (And How to Protect Your Sales With It)
s: What is Amazon brand gating? Brand gating on Amazon prevents counterfeit sellers from selling your product, so you can earn more Amazon sales.

t: Sales collapse forces 'woke' mega-brand to make humiliating U-turn and relist on Amazon | Daily Mail Online
s: 4 days ago - America's most popular shoe is coming back to Amazon. It's the end of a five-year hiatus.

t: Why do I see so many virtually identical products under different brands when searching for products Amazon? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 2): Because they likely are identical products - the only thing different about them is the brand and perhaps the packaging. These private label products are likely all sourced from the same factory or group of factories, and the brand owners did not bother taking the time or effort...

November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: How Amazon’s big private-label business is growing and leaving small brands to protect against knockoffs
s: October 12, 2022 - Amazon continues to invest in private labels such as AmazonBasics, despite accusations that the company copies some of its top-selling third-party products.

t: What Does Amazon's 'Top Brand' Badge Actually Mean? | WIRED
s: August 16, 2019 - Amazon is experimenting with yet another mysterious badge to help shoppers sort through the millions of choices its marketplace offers.

t: Brand Stores: Create a brand page on Amazon for free | Amazon Ads
s: Brand Stores help build brand awareness by showcasing your brand and product catalog on your own Amazon web address. You can create a Brand Store at no additional cost—with no coding necessary.

t: Why do some products on Amazon look the same but have different brand names? - Quora
s: Answer: This is simple to answer. They look similar because the different brands are using the same supplier. This is ok but I suspect they are taking a generic product (like skin cream or headphones) but are not doing any modifications beyond putting their brand name on the product and packaging...
